subject: Mental Health
title: Grief vs. Depression
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Grief vs. Depression.

hook.text: Grief and depression look alike on the surface but are fundamentally different processes.

buildup.text: Both involve sadness, sleep disruption, and withdrawal â€” the overlap causes confusion.

discovery.text: Grief comes in waves; depression is a constant weight. Grief preserves self-esteem; depression attacks it.

twist.text: About 10 percent of bereaved people develop clinical depression on top of their grief.

climax.text: Recognizing the difference determines whether someone needs support or clinical treatment.

punchline.text: Grief says I lost something I love. Depression says I am lost.

quiz.question: How does grief differ from depression?
options: Grief comes in waves and preserves self-esteem; depression is constant and attacks it
Depression involves sadness but grief does not
